subtitle: recently i've been asked
many times the big question
will the world change will people change
due to this pandemic
due to this disruption destabilization
disorientation or are we just going to
go back to way things were
which is usually the case even when
there are big wake-up calls
and big shifts when things go back to
normal people gravitate back to their
old patterns and routines and yet
it's still dragging on so it's just a
matter of time
let me tell you my response i don't
believe
that things radically change overnight
yes there are events cataclysmic events
in history
world wars and other major events
that create a change but over time
things sometimes gravitate back however
incremental change is the way to look at
things
the big picture you don't look at one
event and the next event
it's a narrative and overall the
narrative continues to progress
the forward march of history a world
that becomes a more refined
a more improved a better and kinder
world
not due to one event not due to two
events
due to a series of events that take
generations and generations
so in that context i would say this year
when we will look back in retrospect
that this year will be a watershed
year will be part of a trend
part of a new patterns emerging
let's take for example around 1995 was
the time
when we give the birth of the internet
or i would say the explosion of the
internet
to the public there was internet back in
the 40s and 50s and 60s and 70s
but the internet became a public domain
in the 90s
mid 90s email i remember it vividly
that definitely was the beginning of a
new era a new area in commerce a new
era in communication a new era in
cooperation
but it's still in its infancy relatively
speaking
we're now 25 years from 1995.
it's like where television was let's say
in the year 1930
however other events took place as well
during this period
9 11 if you recall and now this pandemic
so if you put it into that context this
pandemic for example
all agree that something will change in
the context of online learning and work
online
there'll be new options new technologies
developed
so it's not necessarily one big leap
it's incremental step by step and the
same thing is psychologically and
emotionally
what i've seen is a deep vulnerability
a deep vulnerability has opened up
therefore a receptivity where the armor
was pierced
our comfort zones our schedules our
control
was weakened will it completely change
things
inc in accumulated accumulatively
with events that have happened and
events that will happen
many of us will be open to new
possibilities
some will be pioneers
and first adopters early adopters
others will take some time so it's a
bigger picture which we shall discuss
the idea how change happens that even
when there are events that disrupt all
of society
still change does not happen
automatically but
we can be part of the problem or part of
the solution
